## Brief introduction

This tutorial aims at describing the different features of the R package `bioRgeo`. The main purpose of the `bioRgeo`'s package is to propose a transparent methodological framework to compare bioregionalization methods. Below is the typical flow chart of bioregions' identification based on a site-species bipartite network or co-occurence matrix with `bioRgeo` (Figure 1). This workflow can be divided into four main steps:

1. Preprocess the data (matrix or network formats)
2. Compute similarity/distance metrics between sites based on species composition
3. Run the different algorithms to identify different set of bioregions
4. Evaluate and visualize the results

## Matrix or Network formats

The `bioRgeo`'s package takes as input site-species information stored in a bipartite network or a co-occurence matrix. It handles both the matrix and network formats throughout the workflow.
